dsls.markdown: ### Please take a moment to respond to these **five quick questions**. Code.org takes your privacy seriously. Your responses here will be kept anonymous. Your teacher can see responses for the whole class, but without names attached.

questions.text: I have the ability to learn computer science.
I like this computer science class.
I feel comfortable in this computer science class.
I want to take more computer science classes in the future.

https://studio.code.org/s/csd5-2023/less.long_instructions:
# Pizza Party

The pizza party data has been put into an app for you, and the answers from another class have been added.  Because this is an app, we can automate the creation of the bar chart from the given data.

# Sample App

Here is an example of an app that uses data to help the user solve a problem.  With a partner, play through the app a few times to see how it works.

Discuss the following questions with your partner:

-   What choice does the app help the user to make? 
-   What data does it use to make that recommendation?
-   How do you think the creators of the app decided on the algorithm that they use to make the choice?
https://studio.code.org/s/csd5-2023/less.teacher_markdown:
Students can see and remix the code to this app at the following URL:

[https://studio.code.org/projects/applab/Xb03UxRLDJ8BnVIMEhb3iTL1MG1HErh1Xy5Fl5IyqdA/view][0]

Student End of Unit Survey - Q3_copy3_20.long_instructions:
What else would you like your teacher to know about this class? For example: what did you like best about the class, or what is one thing that could make the class better?

(Your responses are anonymous. Your teacher can see responses for the whole class, but without names attached)

answers.text: How many people are currently attending
How much does it cost to attend
What time do games start and end
How much the electricity costs per game
What other events are happening at the same time

questions.text: Your school is trying to increase attendance at sports games. What data is LEAST likely to help solve your problem?

dsls.teacher_markdown:
**Content: Unit 5 Lesson 9, 10, 11**

Knowing how much the electricity costs doesn't help you increase attendance at sports games.

dsls.markdown:
You want to find out what your classmates are most excited about this year, so you create a survey. The options are: 
* Dances
* Volleyball games
* Basketball games
* Band concerts
* Orchestra concerts
* The yearly drama play
* Graduation.

When you look at the survey results, you notice some responses don't fit the options. Which of the following responses should be *deleted* when cleaning the data? (*Select two*) 

(*Do not select responses that should be cleaned in order to fit into one of the categories*)
dsls.teacher_markdown:
**Content: Unit 5 Lesson 9, 10, 11**

"Thanks for asking!" and "Anything with my friends" don't fit any category. The others can be updated to fit into a category.

dsls.markdown:
Given the following cross tabulation of favorite pets and activities, is this statement true or false? "_If I like music, I'm mostly likely to like birds._"
| | Dog | Cat | Bird | Snake | | ----------- | :-----------: | :-----------: | :-----------: | :-----------: | | Camping | II | | I | I | | Art | | IIIII | | | | Video Games | III | I | | I | | Music | IIIIII | II | I | I |
dsls.teacher_markdown:
**Content: Unit 5 Lesson 11, 12**

If someone likes music, they are most likely to like dogs.

answers.text: If your favorite food is ice cream, add 1 point to National Park. Do not add points to anywhere else.
If your favorite food is pizza, add 1 point to Beach. Do not add points to anywhere else.
If your favorite food is salad, add 1 point to Big City and 2 points to National Park.
If your favorite food is Sandwiches, add 2 points to Beach and 1 point to National Park.

dsls.markdown:
Given this cross-tabulation, which of the following rules makes the most sense in an algorithm to recommend a vacation spot? (_The location with the most points will be recommended_)
| | Beach | Amusement Park | Big City | National Park | | ----------- | :-----------: | :-----------: | :-----------: | :-----------: | | Ice Cream | IIIII | II | I | - | | Pizza | I | II | II | I | | Salad | - | - | I | IIIII | | Sandwiches | II | - | - | III |

questions.text: Which word is best defined as "a way of representing information using only two options"?

dsls.markdown:
Using this ASCII system, what does the message represent?
| ASCII system | Message | | ----------- | ----------- | | | |

questions.text: How would you represent 15 using binary? *Remember that gray squares are covering what you don't want to include in your total.*

dsls.teacher_markdown:
**Content: Unit 5 Lesson 5**

Since the four boxes to the right are uncovered, this representation is equal to 8 + 4 + 2 + 1 = 15.

dsls.markdown:
Think back to how we encrypted and decrypted data for the third row in records like the one pictured below. When applying that method, what is the decrypted medical record of the encrypted record below?

*If the two boxes above it are the same color it black. Otherwise, leave it white*

![](https://images.code.org/c40a5a98ae8f6dd1e9768a6e642ad9b0-CSDunit5encrypt.png)

Some people took a survey about their favorite season and whether they are a morning or night person. Their results are included in the chart below. Which of the following represents a cross-tabulation of the data (*exluding the names of those surveyed*)?
|
Names
|
Season
|
Time of Day
| | :-----------: | :-----------: | :-----------: | | Aiden | Spring | Night | | Amara | Spring | Night | | Jai | Summer | Night | | Mei | Summer | Night | | Omar | Winter | Morning | | Sora | Summer | Night | | Fatima | Spring | Morning | | Kai | Winter | Morning |

CSD U5 FR Q1_2023.long_instructions: Remember how we stored each pet's information in a record. Imagine you want to store the number of classmates you had each period of the school day. How would you encode that information in binary?

CSD U5 FR Q2_2023.long_instructions: You want to increase the amount of recycling at school. You've already counted the number of recycling cans on campus. What other information would you want to collect to make an even better decision?

CSD U5 FR Q3_2023.long_instructions: You want to improve mental health at school. What questions could you ask that could help you collect data about this issue?

CSD U5 FR Q4_2023.long_instructions: What is the purpose of cleaning a data set?
